messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
How far am I from the Golden Gate Bridge
Sure—could you let me know roughly where you’re located (a city or, even better, your latitude / longitude)? That will let me calculate the distance from you to the Golden Gate Bridge.
I actually don't know my current location.
No problem. Even a rough idea of where you are—such as the nearest city, a ZIP/postal code, or a landmark—will let me estimate the distance. Could you share any clue about your current location?
Sorry, I really have no idea where I am right now.

I’m afraid I can’t calculate the distance unless I have at least a rough idea of your current location. Here are a few quick ways you can figure that out:

•  Smartphone: Most phones show your latitude/longitude in the compass or map app (often by tapping the blue “you are here” dot).  
•  Laptop browser: Type “What’s my location” into your search engine—many browsers will show your coordinates if you grant location permission.  
•  GPS-enabled watch or fitness tracker: Check its “current coordinates” or “where am I” screen.  
•  Ask a local business or look for a street sign, ZIP/postal code, or town name. Even that is enough for a ball-park figure.  

Once you have any of the following, I can give you an accurate or approximate distance:
- Latitude/longitude  
- City or town name  
- ZIP/postal code  

If you can get any of that information, let me know and I’ll do the calculation right away.
Can you try using location services to figure it out?

I’m sorry—I don’t have the ability to read your device’s GPS data or use location services automatically. (For privacy reasons, chat assistants like me can’t pull that information.) If you can get even a rough location—city, ZIP/postal code, or, best of all, latitude/longitude—I can immediately calculate the distance to the Golden Gate Bridge for you.

Quick ways you can grab your coordinates:

• On a smartphone: Open Google Maps or Apple Maps, tap the blue “my-location” dot, and look for the latitude/longitude numbers.  
• In a desktop browser: Search “What’s my location” and allow the page to access your location—most browsers will show coordinates.  
• On a GPS watch/fitness tracker: Check its “current coordinates” or “Where am I?” screen.  
• Ask someone nearby (e.g., “What town or ZIP code is this?”) or look at a street sign.

Once you have any of those details, just tell me and I’ll calculate the distance right away.
Could you to try finding the distance on your side somehow?

I’m sorry, but I don’t have any way to detect where you are—I only have the information you provide in the chat. Without at least a rough location (a city, ZIP/postal code, or latitude/longitude), I can’t calculate the distance to the Golden Gate Bridge. If you can supply even a rough clue of where you are, I’ll be happy to work it out immediately.
